title: How to Enable Earthquake Alerts on iPhone

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . This app has a settings gear on a gray background.

steps.title: Choose Notifications.
steps.content: Choose Notifications . This is the first item in the second section.

steps.title: Scroll down to the bottom.
steps.content: Scroll down to the bottom. Look for the section called "Government Alerts".

steps.title: Toggle "Emergency Alerts" and/or "Public Safety Alerts" to .
steps.content: Toggle "Emergency Alerts" and/or "Public Safety Alerts" to . This will enable all emergency alerts, including earthquake and tsunami alerts. You will receive notice of earthquakes with a magnitude of 5.0 or higher and seismic intensity of 4 (on the Mercalli scale in California) or 5-/5 lower (on the Shindo scale in Japan).

steps.title: Open the App Store .
steps.content: Open the App Store . This app has an A on a blue background.

steps.title: Tap on the search button in the corner.
steps.content: Tap on the search button in the corner. This will open up the search page.

steps.title: Type "MyShake" into the search box.
steps.content: Type "MyShake" into the search box. Then click on Search .

steps.title: Tap on GET.
steps.content: Tap on GET . This will download the MyShake app to your iPhone.

steps.title: Open the app.
steps.content: Open the app. This app has a network of circles connected with lines.

steps.title: Accept the licensing agreement.
steps.content: Accept the licensing agreement. For you to use the app to view or receive earthquake alerts, you must accept the licensing agreement.

steps.title: Enable notifications and location services.
steps.content: Enable notifications and location services. This is required for the app to function. Without it, you will not receive alerts when strong tremors are imminent.
